## Description {#details}

A struct defining useful bit patterns for n-bits integer types.

Definition at line 94 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/bitfields-h">Bitfields.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Typedefs

### Unsigned {#a256d10f001d8a689a25cf658d47e73e3}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T, unsigned Bits&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>using llvm::bitfields&#95;details::BitPatterns&lt; T, Bits &gt;::Unsigned =  std::make&#95;unsigned&#95;t&lt;T&gt;</>}>
Bit patterns are forged using the equivalent <code><a href="#a256d10f001d8a689a25cf658d47e73e3">Unsigned</a></code> type because of undefined operations over signed types (e.g.

Bitwise shift operators). Moreover same size casting from unsigned to signed is well defined but not the other way around.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/bitfields-h/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/bitfields-h">Bitfields.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
